title: Smile sets sail for Europe’s Spaceport in French Guiana
summary: Just over a year since Smile arrived in the Netherlands in two parts, the now-complete and thoroughly-tested spacecraft has left for good. With a launch window set for 8 April – 7 May on a Vega-C rocket, the joint European-Chinese mission is almost ready to embark upon its unique space mission.

title: The stellar lifecycle in a nearby spiral
Winds Whip Up Fires and Dust on the Southern Plains
summary: Dry, gusty conditions spurred fast-growing fires in Oklahoma and Kansas, along with dangerous dust storms across the region.

title: Moon mission fueling test concludes with no major problems
summary: The practice countdown began Tuesday night, kicking off a carefully choreographed series of steps to ready the world's most powerful operational rocket for what amounted to a simulated launch Thursday at 8:42 p.m. EST. Controllers then carried out additional tests to make sure the team can recycle, hold and restart an actual launch countdown as needed to handle unexpected problems.

title: Artemis II Could Launch As Soon as March Following Successful WDR
summary: Today’s successful Artemis II Wet Dress Rehearsal (WDR) positions NASA to launch astronauts around the Moon  for the first time in over 50 yearsa s soon as next month. This […]

title: Independent report sharply criticizes NASA management, Boeing for troubled Starliner flight
summary: NASA Administrator Jared Isaacman said NASA will continue working with Boeing to make the Starliner a viable crew transport vehicle, adding that "sustained crew and cargo access to low Earth orbit will remain essential, and America benefits from competition and redundancy."

title: NASA Classifies Starliner CFT as Type-A Mishap, Leadership Changes Coming
summary: At a quickly announced news conference today, NASA Administrator Jared Isaacman released NASA’s investigation into the 2024 Boeing Starliner Crew Flight Test incident. Acknowledging that the Starliner spacecraft itself has […]

title: Live coverage: SpaceX to launch second Falcon 9 rocket to return to a landing in The Bahamas
summary: The Starlink 10-34 mission will be SpaceX’s 20th Falcon 9 launch of the year so far. Liftoff from pad 40 is set for 8:41:40 p.m. EST (0141:40).

title: NASA chief classifies Starliner flight as "Type A" mishap, says agency made mistakes
summary: "The most troubling failure revealed by this investigation is not hardware."
